turns.speaker: HISPANIC KID
turns.text: Yeah... Mmmm, that sounds good... Uhu...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Excuse me, we need to make a call.

turns.speaker: HISPANIC KID
turns.text: So's this.  Hey baby... Oh, nothing. What were you saying?

turns.speaker: HISPANIC KID
turns.text: I be off in a minute.  Say again...?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're supposed to meet him here. Is Ruiz on the list?

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: Ruiz is always on the list. He just ain't here, though.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Thanks a lot. Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Did Max mention anything about any jobs?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You said if you didn't have a winning record after eleven fights, you'd talk to Max.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So, it's not a winning record.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: That's not what you said. You said if you didn't have a winning record --

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I wouldn't keep bugging you, but you said he said he would have a job for us.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not gonna bring it up to him.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Of course I don't want you to bring it up to him... But if it comes up...

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah. Page me. You know the number?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Cause if you don't know the number, I can page you with the number so you'll have the number.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I'll page you with the number. I'll see you later. What time you done?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Ask if he said anything to her.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I'll page you with the number.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So I'm like, 'Maybe I'm not on the list cause I'm not a fuckin Persian.'

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I thought you hate that club.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I do. It's a fuckin Persian Palace.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Then why do you try to get in?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Come on, man. Not with the owners here.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Hey, baby... Nothing. What are you doing...? Yeah, I'll probably cut out early...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He didn't say we need guns.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You don't imply about something like that. You lay it out on the table. Besides, I'm not taking the job.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: This is the opportunity of a lifetime. What are you? Nuts? You've been waiting for this kind of opportunity.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. You've been waiting for this kind of opportunity.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Damn right, I have. You think I like living on fucking Yucca? We do a good job on this, we're in.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What happened to boxing? I thought we made a vow.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Shit. Who we kidding? I know I suck, and I held you up for ten rounds --

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Please. I got three inches on you. You wouldn't have landed a punch if I didn't let you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I still can't believe you missed the fucking team bus.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Your first start at DB, it's against Fairfax, and you miss the fucking bus.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're not delivering shit. Ruiz is delivering something, and whatever it is is his business.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maxie says he runs a tight ship. I wouldn't fuck with him.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Some Mexican? How much could he weigh? A buck fifty, tops? I'd kick his fucking ass.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I gotta pick up the baby.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Why do you always get stuck taking care of the kid.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Shhh...  Yeah, yeah... No. No. I'll be there.  You gotta get me to the Magic Castle at four.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I tried your ATM PIN. I gotta kill an hour. Let's grab a beer.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: No, man. It wrinkles my shit. Let's grab a fuckin beer --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: C'mon, man, not in front of the baby. Put on your seat belt before I get another ticket.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: See? Now everyone's got one on.  What do you got there?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Why can't we just grab a goddamn beer.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I promised Chloe we'd come here.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Oh, give me a break. Look at her. She don't even know where the hell she is. She'd have more fun at Bordner's.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not taking her to a bar.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Why not? I grew up in bars. It's fun for a kid.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She wants you to paint the ashtray.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I'm not painting the fu --, I'm not painting the ashtray. And frogs aren't purple.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Max won't let me drive Jess to dance anymore.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: This paint sucks. The white shows through.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Holy shit. Can you believe this?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: See, man. Maxie fuckin takes care of you when you're in. Beats cleaning carpets.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You hear that? You can drink as much as you want up here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're not supposed to get drunk. We're on call.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Unless we're supposed to whack out the fuckin' pilot, I don't think we're gonna have to work in the next five hours.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't want to show up hammered. We're supposed to be representing Max.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shit. No new pages. I don't even know where the fuck we're supposed to go.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Maybe we should call for a cab.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. He said that's our account with the car service.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah, bring up two burgers and a couple of Heinekens. I'm in room... How'd you know? Oh. Yeah. How long? Cool.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: How much? Okay. Make it fifteen minutes and you can add on a ten dollar tip. Bye.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Relax. You got one-fifty. You heard the guy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ricky, who knows how long we're gonna have to be here. We gotta make it last.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Fine. I'll put it on my room. Okay?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't worry about it. Just be smart.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: But let me tell you, man, I don't like your attitude already.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: We just got moved up in the world. You gotta let go of that blue collar mentality that was drummed into your head. You gotta start owning it man, or they'll smell you a mile away like a cheap suit.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who's gonna smell me a mile away?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Don't play dumb. You know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I know you're not calling Jimmy.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: As a matter of fact I was. You got a problem with that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're here representing Max. You're acting like a Puerto Rican on the fifteenth of the month.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You think Maxie doesn't want us to roll hard? Why do you think he gave us all this bread? Or the number on the pager? We gotta represent him by showing some class. The man's got an operation. How does it reflect on him if we nickel and dime it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's on West Broadway. We can walk.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Well, I don't want to walk.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shit. It's thirty-five cents. You got a dime?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: They said a hundred thirty-fifth and Twelfth.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I told you what they said.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: How'd they know who you were?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So they said more than the address.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. They asked who I was, then told me what corner.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the fuck do you have to complain about?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. Tell me. What's so fucking horrible about this gig? You've been crawling up my ass for six months to get your name on Maxie's list, and here we are.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Look, man, I never met Ruiz, okay? I don't know what the fuck I'm picking up, what the fuck I'm dropping off, who the fuck I'm meeting. All I know is Maxie's still pissed at me cause I sold his fucking van.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You sold it? I thought they stole it.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Oh, give me a break. Don't tell me you feel bad for the guy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You gotta be kidding me. I vouched for you.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Relax. I'll do right by him. You know that.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You just don't fucking get it, do you?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You know he fucks all his girls, don't you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the fuck is that supposed --

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I mean, that's what I heard --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: His names Horrace. Horrace, this is Ricky Slade.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: This shit's sketchy. Why do they drop us in the middle of nowhere to have the guy we're supposed to meet come meet us just to tell us we have to meet the same guy somewhere else?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Well, I thought you understood and I was just missing it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Missing what? He didn't say shit.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah, but you know Horrace. What did you get off him?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I detected no vibe other than that Ruiz thinks you're a fucking idiot.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yo, fuck him, man. Calling us guineas...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What do you give a shit what he calls us? He's not our friend. Let's just get this shit over with and go home. What's this place we're going to, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Like I said, I don't know.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why you gotta make everything difficult?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, me too. You're a fucking bull in a china shop.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You can't go in there. They know you're with Ruiz.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Fuck you. Go then. I'm taking the car.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Look who's back? Want some champagne?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Do not put this on Ruiz's tab. Start a new one.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Damn right. Bring us two bottles of Dom Champs and here, take fifty in case I call you bitch later when I'm drunk.  Siddown, motherfucker.  'Sex and paychecks.'

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Dude, get back out there. You gotta help me get them in the hot tub.  Hang on girls! Just get out there. I'll be right out. You know how I do.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, I know how you do. I know how you do. I've heard your kibbles and bits all fucking night. You've been shaking your ass like an unemployed clown. How the room's a boiling pot of sugar water. How you're gonna dip a string into it and make rockcandy. Who wants to play 'Just the tip?' Dancing around like a smacked ass. Oh, and that coat check girl you've been dragging around as 'insurance' doesn't even speak English.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the hell did you do?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I swear to God, I didn't do anything.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the fuck was that about?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hi.  It's Ruiz.  Yeah. So the driver knows where to go? When? We'll be down in five. No, I'll tell him. He's right there. Bye.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He wants to see us now.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He said it's being arranged. He said Jimmy will know.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Why else you think he won't tell us where the sit down is?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's not a 'sit down.' He said he's telling us the plan.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I got a bad feeling, man. I don't want to go in naked.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You gonna shank him in the shower?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Is it so unrealistic to think Ruiz, who doesn't even want us here, is throwing us to the wolves? As an apology? And I don't even know what we're dropping off or picking up --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're getting ahead of ourselves. We haven't gotten any sleep. Let's just keep our mouthes shut and not make any mistakes. Now hurry up and get your shit on so we're not late and make things worse.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I swear to God, I'll fucking puke.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Hey, Jimmy, where they taking us?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. Where they gonna whack us?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You want us strapped, don't you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Wait a minute. You want to look at fucking penguins now?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah. Let's look at the penguins.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Did you hear what he just said?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Whatever. We're here. We may as well go to the penguin house.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm tired and I'm scared, and I'm not looking at fucking penguins.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I listened extremely carefully. Nothing was even vaguely implied. He even laughed in your face when you asked him

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You wouldn't even know where to get one.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You couldn't even get a hand job from bridge and tunnel posse, how you gonna get a gun?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: That's cause you decided to get all tired all of a sudden.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It was six in the fucking morning.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You wanna see how fast I get a gun?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What happened to the fifteen hundred?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You coulda picked up a tab every once in a while.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I did! I paid for half the fuckin drinks!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yes I did. You asshole! What about the room?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: They only cover one fifty in incidentals. You've been ordering fucking... Motherfucker...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I fucking vouched for you. I vouched for you and you fucked me.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: This shit's peanuts compared to what we're gonna make with Maxie.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ricky. I'm trying to save this money. Understand? I'm trying to make it so my girlfriend doesn't have to grind her ass into other men's erections so her daughter can go to private school.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: This is horseshit. It coulda been so easy.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Let's get some sleep. That's what we need, man. Sleep.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How we gonna sleep? We only got a few hours til dinner.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Let's just go now and wait.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't want to take any more chances.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Let's just go get guns, I'd feel better.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't fuck around. You're gonna get us all killed.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Think about it: You knocked out that Jewish kid's tooth, cost him eight grand, maybe more. Maybe lost his whole line of clientele? He knows you're fucking up Jess' dancing, and I got a feeling he knows I stole his carpet cleaning van by the way he looks at me. He can't kill us in LA cause that leads to too many questions. So he flies us out here first class for a 'drop' that's turned into whatever? He can make us disappear out here real nice...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where do you get this shit?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Scenario B. I think I'm getting under Ruiz's skin. I'm no dummy. He doesn't like how it went down with the Red Drag -- Welshman, whatever. Now I got Fruitpie the Magician telling me I can't call my man Max? And that Welshman's sketchy.  Whatever, I don't know where it's coming, which way it's coming from, I'm telling you one thing right now, I'm not gonna be late for the dance.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Look. They're together. You telling me this ain't a set-up?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Holy shit. Get me back to Manhattan.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Take us right to Kennedy. Now.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll drop you off in a minute. I want to see if the baby's up. You wanna come in?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: We rep lines? You know? Fashion?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: And you grew up in Manhattan?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I don't wear a white wig, I don't carry a gavel.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: That's a good idea, maybe I will!

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Well, come on then. It's back here.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You want to come splash around.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I'm just warning you, I can't swim.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I want to leave right now.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Watch out, man. Sorry. I'm on the list, man.  Hey, bro.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah, but, we're good. You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: How is it you're good? You on a list?

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: Maybe you wanna try the China Club.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Again with the fucking China Club! What do I look like a fucking Persian to you?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Did you see that shit? Motherfucker.  You let in fucking Screech, dude? I'm waiting and you let in Screech?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Show me. Show me where it says Screech on the fucking list.

turns.speaker: DOORMAN
turns.text: You look big, man. Diesel. You been lifting?

turns.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
turns.text: It's in your copy of Hemispheres. I believe it's Mickey Blue Eyes.

turns.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
turns.text: I'll get you the list of videos, if you don't mind, I'll offer the other passengers a beverage.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah, sure. How much are they?

turns.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
turns.text: You're up front. Everything's free up here.

turns.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
turns.text: Yes.  Would you care for another one?

turns.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
turns.text: I operate out of the Chicago O'Hare hub. Can I help you with anything else?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah. Me and my boy here are gonna be in New York overnight. I want you to pass the word around to the honeys back in business class that you all got plans for tonight. I'm talkin' a California style, Tupac, gangster pool party back at the hotel. And make that drink a double.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Jimmy knows. 13th Street. We'll meet you there.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: How do you know it's not drugs?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Maxie knows I don't go near drugs. I did a minute in Quentin for possession with intent. And it ain't now cause he woulda told me.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: It means you got a gun?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: I know what 'strapped' means, motherfucker. What the fuck you think this shit is? '21 Jump Street?'  Cool out, they're coming back. Just throw up your screw face and don't speak unless spoken to.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Don't drag my ass into this --

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: He spoke to me. You want me to dis him?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: I'm not saying shit to neither of you.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I'll tell him someone else told me.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Just don't ask me no more shit.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: The Welsh dude, sees all these niggers in perms and diamonds and shit, he gets nervous. But you motherfuckers, he just laughs. All beat up in your babaloo suit like Fruitpie the Magician.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So we just go eat with him and that's gonna solve everything?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Dude, you just gotta settle your shit down. You gotta go and say all that 'Red Dragon' shit. Make him think he's on Barretta.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Like you were doing any better shucking and jiving like you were waiting for wings outside the Quick and Split.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: I don't fuck with those crazy, off- the-boat fuckin Irish. You heard of the Westies?.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Nah, see, Maxie just asked him to set that shit up as a favor. He, you know, he tied in with the club. Set us up so, you know, you feel at home.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: Well, I didn't care for the club much. And, I must say, I didn't care for him either.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Well, he ain't gonna be around no more.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: Pity. What's say we have a drink?

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: I hear the China Club is a laugh.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: I've heard you've got the best coke in the States. The shit back home is pants.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: Sorry, mates. Now there isn't even enough to go around...

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Don't worry, man. It's all for you.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: No, thanks, man. We got to head out.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: Come, now. You just got here.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: That's alright, man. It's a little early for me to drink.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: Sorry about that. Where's your mate?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Couldn't make it. Here's the money.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: I can't yet vouch for the amount, unless you want me to sit here and count.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: No, man, that's fine. Just put that you took delivery.

turns.speaker: WELSHMAN
turns.text: I... I just hired these guys to watch my back...

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Motherfucker, we're handing you money. What the hell we gonna pull?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Jimmy? Ruiz. Pick up Maxie's guineas at LUNA and bring them to Spa.  Jimmy's bringing the car around. Me and Ho rode sleds. We'll meet you at Spa in the VIP room.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: You think this shit's funny, Ho?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Last thing I want is you with a gun.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah. Grab one of the cards behind you. Call that number. It's my cell.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So you're our own private guy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I handle most of Cardiff Giant's stuff.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I don't know. I thought you might. Any idea what the job is?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The 'job?' Alls I know is I'm taking you to the Soho Grand.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Nigger, please. Don't even order that artichoke shit. West side guineas. Forget the drinks, Leo. We gotta roll. What do I owe you?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Thanks, man. You need anything, you call.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Can I borrow a piece of --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Go ahead. Open the fuckin things. You should each find fifteen hundred --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: dollars in c-notes, a numeric pager, a double-A battery, and a first class round-trip ticket to JFK.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes. You're going to New York.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: And the money. Where do we bring the money?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That money is your per diem.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: And where do we bring it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You will not carry any other pagers with you. You will not carry anything, for that matter, that I have not just given you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You can carry your keys. You will not mention my name or imply that you are in my employ. You will not speak to anyone while you are working. When you are not working, you are considered to be 'on call' and available twenty-four hours a day. This means you will not get drunk or do anything that will prevent you from operating in a professional manner. There is already a number in your pager's memory. It is a car service. When they ask you what account, you will respond: 'Cardiff Giant.' They will pick you up and take you anywhere you need to go. In other words, there is no reason why you should not reach any destination that you will be called upon to reach within fifteen minutes. Do you see a pattern forming?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So tell me how it is.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You want... Why are you picking on me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Because you lost my fucking carpet cleaning van and I don't like you.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So, wait, what are we dropping off?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I never intended to test you two to that extent, but you both came through. I should've been informed there was a flag on the play, but I'll take that up with Ruiz. I made a few calls back East. Those punks weren't tied in with anyone. As for the Welshman, he wasn't in on it. He was just plain dumb. As for you, Ricky, your draw will go towards a new carpet cleaning van.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And, as for you, Bobby, you just moved up a notch. Your days of fighting for crumbs is through. Take a week off, come back, and we'll talk about the next thing.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: What, motherfucker? You drinking 'the witch' after dinner?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah. That fernet tastes like tar. My grandfather tried to give me that.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Some fuckin guineas he sent me. It's midnight and the motherfucker's ordering an apertif.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: We don't know any drill. Nobody told us anything.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Maxie told you to keep your mouth shut while you're working, right?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: What the fuck you think, I wanna 'hang' with you motherfuckers? Yeah you're working. And put down the champagne.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Far as she knows you're John Gotti. Now put the shit down and act like you got some ass.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: What the fuck was you told? Don't talk, right?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Unless spoken to, ain't that right, Horrace. Didn't you say that?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Four mimosas.  You'll love them. So here's the plan. I didn't say shit to Maxie, cause the man has acute angina, and I don't want to get him all worked up.
